V.ii.3.D.1.d
.
When to Avoid Rating by Analogy
When a condition is specifically listed in the rating schedule, it may not be rated by analogy.
When there is a diagnosis of two separate conditions, apply the DC(s) that specifically pertains to the listed conditions and determine the appropriate disability evaluations.
Reference
:Â  For more information on analogous ratings, see
Copeland v. McDonald
, 27 Vet.App. 333 (2015)
.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section D - Evaluating Disabilities
citation: Part V, Subpart ii, Chapter 3, Section D
